relevant_findings.description: nondysmorphic; anorexia leading to insufficient food intake; very poorly developed adipose tissue; normal male external genitalia; palpable testis volume 3 ml; clinodactyly of the fifth finger.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weight and height showed deterioration over time. At 2.8 years, height was 76 cm (which is a decline) and weight was 7 kg.

relevant_findings.description: Bone age was 18 months; GH stimulation tests showed basal serum GH concentrations of 0.7 ng/ml and a peak concentration of 26 ng/ml after stimulation.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Growth velocity decreased during a reduction of GH therapy dosage (0.2 mg/kg). No significant growth was observed during 14 months of GH withdrawal.

relevant_findings.description: No signs of dysmorphia; persistent microcephaly.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 10.6 years, head circumference showed persistent microcephaly, but behavioral assessments revealed only mild developmental delay.
